meanings.definition: A telephone that is connected by wires to a network.
meanings.sent1: My grandma still uses a landline to make calls.
meanings.sent2: The landline in our house is a reliable way to communicate.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tripped over the landline and almost pulled it out of the wall!
meanings.sent4: The landline hummed softly, connecting us to the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The landline's ring echoed through the quiet house, breaking the silence.

meanings.definition: The physical location of a telephone line.
meanings.sent1: The technician needed to check the landline to fix the issue.
meanings.sent2: The landline for our house runs along the street.
meanings.sent3: I imagined a tiny landline on a map, showing where the phone was connected.
meanings.sent4: The landline stretched across the city, linking homes and businesses.
meanings.sent5: In my mind, the landline was a bright line connecting one place to another.
